newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-MIDDLESBROUGH RELEASE BRAZILIAN DEFENDER BRANCO.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MIDDLESBROUGH RELEASE BRAZILIAN DEFENDER BRANCO.

text.p: Branco, a member of Brazil's 1994 World Cup winning side, has been released by English premier league side Middlesborough with eight months of his contract to run.
Signed by manager Bryan Robson last February, Branco, 32, has played only six league games for the club.
He was one of a clutch of big-name internationals signed by the relatively unfashionable north-east club, including countrymen Juninho and Emerson and Italian striker Fabrizio Ravinelli.
Robson, an admirer of Branco's attacking skills, needs to tighten a defence that has conceded 11 goals in the past four games.
The club have agreed to pay off the remainder of Branco's contract, believed to be worth 500,000 sterling ($782,000).
"I am glad I was able to help Boro out during a difficult period," he said on Wednesday. "Also, I was able to give my great friend Juninho the help and encouragement he needed."
